titleStmt.title: Good nevvs for the nation, or, The citys joy and the countries happiness. Plainly shewing the great satisfaction and content, that all loyal subjects do enjoy, by the new election of members of Parliament, whom God preserve, and direct, that they may act for the good of their King, and country, and the benifit and happiness of all true English Protestants. Tune of Digbys farwel, or Packintons pound·

Good nevvs for the nation, or, The citys joy and the countries happiness. Plainly shewing the great satisfaction and content, that all loyal subjects do enjoy, by the new election of members of Parliament, whom God preserve, and direct, that they may act for the good of their King, and country, and the benifit and happiness of all true English Protestants. Tune of Digbys farwel, or Packintons pound·

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for P[hilip]. Brooksby at the Golden Ball in West-Smithfield.,

notesStmt.note: Verse: "Come all loyal subjects of every degree ..."
Date of publication and publisher's name from Wing CD-ROM, 1996.
Reproduction of original in the Harvard University, Houghton Library.
